titleStmt.title: འཕྲུལ་གྱི་མེ་ལོང་དགུ་སྐོར་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་རྩ་འགྲེལ།
'phrul gyi me long dgu skor zhes bya ba'i rtsa 'grel/
The Root Text and Commentary on “The Nine Cycles of the Mirror of Magical Emanations”

change.desc: The nine are enumerated at the start of the text as: (1) illuminating the object of enlightenment with regard to mistaken ideas, (2) all phenomena being the same or not the same in the mind, (3) for whom is attainment accomplished spontaneously, (4) does the appearance of suchness exist or not exist, (5) is buddhahood primordial or not, (6) how is it that sentient beings of the three realms are mistaken, (7) what is the meaning of mistakenness, (8) what is the essence of the yogic view, and (9) what are the doubts concerning these. According to the Blue Annals (Roerich, 349), Atīśa taught this text to Rin-chen-bzang-po to correct his mistaken understanding of tantric practice.
